text: my name is Charles Isherwood I'm a
theatre critic for the New York Times
for me the actual play of the year
I guess I'd call it is the aliens by
Honey Baker Annie Baker who sort of
sprang forth last year with her play
circle mirror transformation Playwrights
Horizons like that play the aliens is
very subtle piece of writing
it's almost Jacobean in the way that the
unspoken and the silences and the
subtext are really what makes it such a
moving experience is about three misfits
who come together in this small Vermont
town and they're just sort of hanging
out in the back of a coffee shop the
relationship among the three of them is
a very moving portrait of how
friendships develop and evolve and it
touches on tragedy too there's a death
in the play the impact of this tragic
event is actually quite delicate and
overall you don't really realize how
powerful the play is until after you
processed it one thing that I think
really helped us the amazing direction
of Sam Gould who has become sort of a
specialist in this kind of a very subtle
theatre the three actors are were just
phenomenal and really well cast in their
roles and so that those are the reasons
why the aliens gets my vote for the best
play of the year for the New York Times
this is Charles Isherwood
